Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2009 11:50AM soaplady1950 wrote: Hi Everyone just wanted to share what i did last nite.  I went to the first annual candle lighting in Perry Square Park in Erie Pa, My doctor surgeon, was the one who put it on her whole staff are so into helping all of us sisters they treat you like part of there family they all did this for us. the city of Erie turns the park fountain pink for the month of october it was emotional, beautiful hard to discribe.  we light the candles and the city light up the fountain in pink it was beautiful. It was also my one year anniversary of finding the tumor Oct 22 was when my nitemare started. one year later here i am celebrating life with other sisters and watching each othe thru this journey. I was surprised how many people are there for you when you need it , it was awesome I Will be at the second annual without fail.            Sharon

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2011 08:49AM - edited Dec 3, 2011 08:51AM by soaplady1950 hello everyone i havent posted for awhile just thought i would share. yesterday it was three years ago that i received first chemo i remember laying on sofa watching christmas parade in local town and not feeling so good. we said then that we would go next year. we have gone to the christmas parade  three years now. it is like the anniversary of the first day of my new life. keep going girls the other  side of it all is so wonderful makes you really realize what you have and could have lost but you are strong and beat it. have a very merry christmas and a happy new year to and keep the hair growing.  sharon

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2009 04:46PM soaplady1950 wrote: Susan, i had the fluff and i use mousse and i also put a little hair product on it called short sexy hair shaping balm it calms the curls and fluff. I love the whole thing fluff or curl i don't care as long as it is hair mine is a little longer than yours and curly. everyday is a new hair experience. it looks like a very short pixie cut. Anyone, is the weight thing common with everyone that did chemo?? i put on 10 # and it all landed in my stomach none of my pants fit anymore, i am going back to weight watchers to see if i can get that part taken care of. i am still having problems with aches and pains in the hands knees and ankle that we not there before chemo it seems to slowly be going back to normal it is amazing just what that poison does to you whole body!!!    have a great hair day   chelev your hair should do some amazing things in the next 5 weeks it amazed me how fast things change. ditching the wig was the hardest for me also i did a little at a time, went to the store and survived i drive school bus so the next step was a baseball cap to work and then one day i ditched that also and everyone was glad to see that i had progressed to that stage of freedom wasn't as bad as i thought the kids didn't even notice one just made a comment that i got a hair cut, some hair cut.   go for the wig ditching you will survive I did and it is wonderful     Sharon

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2009 05:51PM - edited Jun 11, 2009 05:55PM by soaplady1950 jancie, hang in there the duck fuzz goes away rather fast i have pictures of what comes in it looks like 5 oclock shadow at first then before you know it it is real hair thin at first then a month later your head is covered i just compaired the pictures from april 10 then may 20 and yesterday what a huge difference i couldn't see it myself because, i like you was looking at all the time to see if it grew and it did.  take some pictures now in 4 weeks and again in 3 weeks you will be amazed i had a friend come up behind me today and run her fingers thru my hair and she told me she loved it with all the soft curls i am begining to like it my self still short in the bangs which is normal it is the same length on top it just takes time for it to become bangs.  i just love having hair again.                                                                                                        sharon

Posts.Content: May 30, 2009 09:23PM soaplady1950 wrote: I DID IT!!!!!!   i went without anything on my except my own hair short as it is my husband has been trying to talk me into it for sometime now and i did it today  i am 18 weeks post chemo and have about 1 1/2 " in some places it is frosted brown and thick but i could not get past the SHORT  i figured everyone would be looking at my chemo do but i don't think anyone did and now i don't care  i have been wearing a baseball cap since a week ago thursday and today I DID IT!!! it was really hard for me to do  but i survived just fine the world did not come to an end . my husband told me how proud of me he is and that made me feel GREAT he has been a rock thru this whole speed bump in the road of life.     sharon

Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2009 09:32AM soaplady1950 wrote: hey everyone, haven't been on in awhile just thought i would share something i saw on Dr Oz yesterday he said that nettle tea and horsetail extract help to grow hair quicker and also stronger nails. also kale is good for this problem  I have been taking biotin and my hair is growing like mad i finished chemo jan23 and i keep my hair cut short have for years it is now back to normal length and i have had it cut 4 times   first to get rid of sloppy neck line, second to get rid of white fuzz third and fourth normal hair cuts.  my hair used to take 8-10 weeks betwwen cuts now it is 4 weeks and it needs it.  i love my post chemo hair it is curly and that  makes short hair so easy just wash and go.  if you have curls don't fight it enjoy it.  the only problem i have is getting my nails back to normal they are stronger than before thanks to biotin but they have these awful ridges very promenent i thought the biotin would help but it hasn't yet anyone else with this problem                          sharon
